title: Ticket #3252: Clean redundant execl code in DC_Exit
description:
DC_Exit in /src/condor_daemon_core.V6/daemon_core_main.cpp around line 310 has the following code, which is almost identical. It should be simplified to remove redundancy. 

#     if (HAVE_EXECL)
		dprintf( D_ALWAYS, "**** %s (%s_%s) pid %lu EXITING BY EXECING %s\n",
				 myName, myDistro->Get(), get_mySubSystem()->getName(), pid,
				 shutdown_program );
		priv_state p = set_root_priv( );
		int exec_status = execl( shutdown_program, shutdown_program, NULL );
		set_priv( p );
		dprintf( D_ALWAYS, "**** execl() FAILED %d %d %s\n",
				 exec_status, errno, strerror(errno) );
#     elif defined(WIN32)
		dprintf( D_ALWAYS,
				 "**** %s (%s_%s) pid %lu EXECING SHUTDOWN PROGRAM %s\n",
				 myName, myDistro->Get(), get_mySubSystem()->getName(), pid,
				 shutdown_program );
		priv_state p = set_root_priv( );
		int exec_status = execl( shutdown_program, shutdown_program, NULL );
		set_priv( p );
		if ( exec_status ) {
			dprintf( D_ALWAYS, "**** _execl() FAILED %d %d %s\n",
					 exec_status, errno, strerror(errno) );
		}
#     else

Proposed, utterly untested, fix: 

#     if (HAVE_EXECL) || defined(WIN32)
		dprintf( D_ALWAYS, "**** %s (%s_%s) pid %lu EXITING BY EXECING %s\n",
				 myName, myDistro->Get(), get_mySubSystem()->getName(), pid,
				 shutdown_program );
		priv_state p = set_root_priv( );
		int exec_status = execl( shutdown_program, shutdown_program, NULL );
		set_priv( p );
		dprintf( D_ALWAYS, "**** execl() FAILED %d %d %s\n",
				 exec_status, errno, strerror(errno) );
#     else
